meanings.definition: To lift or gather something with a scoop.
meanings.sent1: She scooped the ice cream into a cone.
meanings.sent2: The child scooped up the sand with a shovel.
meanings.sent3: He scooped the toys off the floor in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: The excavator scooped out a huge hole in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef skillfully scooped out the avocado flesh.

meanings.definition: To report a news story before other media outlets.
meanings.sent1: The journalist scooped the latest scandal for her newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The reporter scooped the exclusive interview with the celebrity.
meanings.sent3: The news anchor scooped the breaking news with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The blogger scooped the trending topic before anyone else.
meanings.sent5: The editor scooped the front-page story ahead of the competition.

meanings.definition: Having a hollowed or rounded shape.
meanings.sent1: The bowl had a scooped design that made it easy to hold.
meanings.sent2: The chair had a scooped seat for added comfort.
meanings.sent3: The helmet had a scooped visor that shielded the sun.
meanings.sent4: The spoon had a scooped end for easy serving.
meanings.sent5: The cup had a scooped handle for a secure grip.
